pageContext.claim: “[Tony Podesta] was Paul Manafort on steroids. He was the biggest one or one of the biggest in Washington. They found him doing many bad things, he was forced to leave his firm. He was going to be -- I don't -- it was going to be a very serious day the following day after he left his firm, you understand what I mean by that. Very bad day for him. Nothing ever happened to him.”
pageContext.analysis: Podesta was among several lobbyists that Manafort helped bring aboard to improve the Ukrainian government’s image between 2012 and 2014, according to the Mueller report. Mueller’s prosecutors referred the case to the Southern District of New York eventually closed the inquiry into Podesta.
